titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller Foundation records, Administration, Program and Policy, RG 3
A Guide to the Rockefeller Foundation records, Administration, Program and Policy, RG 3 FA1614

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 18:02:20 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation records, Administration, Program and Policy, RG 3

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in 4 subgroups, based solely on when the material was processed, and thereunder in series. Select program and policy records may also be found within project files (SG 1.7 (A81) through the present.).
Within each subgroup the Administration, Program and Policy records are arranged in series. Some of the commonly found series include:

Series 900: General Program and Policy. Series 901: Social Health and Welfare. Series 902: Charter, Constitution, and By-Laws. Series 903: Members and Meetings. Series 904: Officers' Conferences. Series 905: Officers' Diaries. Series 906: Medical Sciences. Series 907: Common Room. Series 908: International Health Division. Series 909: Insurance, Medical Care, Personnel. Series 910: Social Sciences. Series 911: Humanities. Series 912: Publicity and Publications. Series 913: Division of Studies. Series 914: Service Departments. Series 915: Natural Sciences and Agriculture. Series 916: Counsel. Series 917: Travel. Series 918: General Education Board. Series 920: Medicine and Public Health. Series 921: Medical Education and Public Health. Series 922: Biological and Medical Research. Series 923: Agriculture. Series 924: Medical and Natural Sciences. Series 925: Arts. Series 926: Biomedical Sciences. Series 927: Environmental Affairs. Series 928: Geographic Medicine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records include: correspondence, memoranda, minutes, and reports.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Rockefeller Foundation has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them. Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.
